resources.string:
MapCalibrator takes an image of a custom map and calibrates it to the real world using 2, 3 or 4 reference points. Use the built in camera function to take a picture of a map or store a digital copy of a map in the MapCalibrator folder in the external storage folder, usually /sdcard.

Use the menu button to see all available options.

The intended workflow is:
1. Import a map from a file (or the camera).
2. Create a reference point.
3. Position the reference point at your current position on the map.
4. Store the reference point.
5. Continue to create new reference points until you are satisfied with the received accuracy.

Calibration methods:
2 points: Will be available in the future. This method only works under some very special circumstances.
3 points: The normal method.
4 points: Suggested method if you are using camera pictures of maps. Takes the skew of the image into account.

Please direct questions and comments to MapCalibrator@gmail.com.

New in this version:

*A lot of changes has been made under the hood to be able to use Fragments. This will make it a lot easier to add good looking stuff in the future, so stay tuned.

NOTE: Take care what is in the "Accuracy" and "Age" fields when you save a reference point. A bad accuracy or an old measurement (if you have changed your position since) will ruin the calibration of the map.

MapCalibrator now contains experimental support for using very large images with full resolution (no down sampling). This support must be enabled in the preferences before loading a map.

MapCalibrator takes an image of a custom map and calibrates it to the real world using 3 reference points.

Use the built in camera to take a picture of a map at the site, or store a high resolution map on the sd-card before going out.

Use the menu button to see all available options.

The intended workflow is:
1. Import a map from a file (or the camera).
2. Create a reference point.
3. Position the reference poin at your current position on the map.
4. Store the reference point.

Please direct questions and comments to MapCalibrator@gmail.com.

The supplied gps coordinates were not in a format that is understood by MapCalibrator.

Please check that the GPS is turned on and that the displayed coordinates look ok.

If you know that you have done nothing wrong, and still get this error, then please contact MapCalibrator@gmail.com and report a bug.

You have previously saved reference points for the map you are now trying to load.
Do you want to use them?

Note that answering \"No\" will erase all previously saved reference points for this map.

Your map have now been successfully calibrated.

From now on, your position will be marked on the map.

You can continue to add more reference points, but in the current implementation they will not be used.
The calibration failed. This is probably due to bad accuracy in the calibration points.
No reference points have been added.
Add new maps by clicking on "NEW MAP".
Use the menu to load maps
Do you want to erase all reference points for this map?
